item.title: Taking 100,000 IU of Vitamin D daily to quarterly - review
item.description:
Has a High Dose of Vitamin D3 Impacted Health Conditions in Older Adults?-A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis Focusing on Dose 100,000 IU

Nutrients. 2024 Jan 14;16(2):252. doi: 10.3390/nu16020252.

Barbara Owczarek 1 2 3, Anna Ziomkiewicz 4, Edyta Łukowska-Chojnacka 1

‘T = tested group, C = Control group, DB = double blind, OL = open label, RCT = randomized clinical trial, NA = not available,

QE = quasiexperimental, BD = bone density, BP = blood pressure, COPD = Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease,

item.title: 14 Conservative Vitamin D recommendations in Ukraine
item.description:
Ukrainian Consensus on Diagnosis and Management of Vitamin D Deficiency in Adults

Nutrients 2024, 16, 270. https://doi.org/10.3390/ nu16020270

Nataliia Grygorieva * , Mykola Tronko 2, Volodymir Kovalenko 3, Serhiy Komisarenko 4 , Tetiana Tatarchuk 5, Ninel Dedukh 1, Mykola Veliky 4®, Serhiy Strafun 6C , Yulia Komisarenko 7C , Andrii Kalashnikov 6 , Valeria Orlenko 2, Volodymyr Pankiv 8 , Oleg Shvets 9 , Inna Gogunska 10 and Svitlana Regeda 11

item.title: Need 2X Vitamin D and other micronutrients if eat 2X more calories
item.description:
The science of micronutrients in clinical practice – Report on the ESPEN symposium

ESPEN ENDORSED RECOMMENDATION| VOL 43, # 1, P268-283, Jan 2024 https://doi.org/10.1016/j.clnu.2023.12.006

Background & aims

The European Society for Clinical Nutrition and Metabolism published its first clinical guidelines for use of micronutrients (MNs) in 2022. A two-day web symposium was organized in November 2022 discussing how to apply the guidelines in clinical practice. The present paper reports the main findings of this symposium.

item.title: Simple vitamin D supplementation - daily, weekly, or monthly
item.description:
Supplementing Vitamin D in Different Patient Groups to Reduce Deficiency

Nutrients 2023, 15(17), 3725; https://doi.org/10.3390/nu15173725

  • Pawel Pludowski ORCID Department of Biochemistry, Radioimmunology and Experimental Medicine, The Children’s Memorial Health Institute, 04-730 Warsaw, Poland

Table of Contents

Recommendations

Introduction: Studies indicate a high prevalence of vitamin D deficiency in both the general population and at-risk groups. Given the association between vitamin D deficiency and various diseases, addressing this concern becomes crucial, especially in situations where routine monitoring is challenging.
